intro: Meconopsis aprica, commonly known as the alpine poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. Meconopsis aprica has palmate leaves that are deeply lobed, and its flowers are borne on slender, hairy stems. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is often cultivated in gardens and protected in its natural habitat.
